intro: Gymnosporia eminiana, commonly known as the Natal thornveld shrub, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and thorny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are compound, typically consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Gymnosporia eminiana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
